reviews.review_msg: GREAT prof.  His notes are mini essays but theyre very clear.  He's very open to questions in lectures and he doesn't go off on weird tangents like other profs.  He's very understanding and his exams are fair!  I studied mostly from notes instead of the text and I did extremely well.
An excellent prof!  Will go out of his way to help students succeed.  There should be more teachers like him.

Went out of his way to help me when I found out I was doing badly in the class. Was extremely helpful, and always friendly in the labs. Writes a lot of notes, but you just have to know what to copy and what not to copy down.
Never liked him in the beginning of the class. Still dont' like him now.  His teaching style was just too wishy washy for me.  Prepare to copy notes like a machine.
Easy midterms, hard final.. Overall a very decent instructor.
Very clear about material for this course. Calculations asked in final was taught in lecture. Easy to follow. She's also scary and intimidating to approach.
Very serious professor, seems to be very busy. Her class is hard, a lot of material to cover. Exams are difficult. She explains things well but quickly.

Her accent is terrible for understanding exactly what she's talking about.  Exams are long and extremely tough.  That aside, she clearly loves what she does and isn't afraid to show that. Would not take again.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Legitimately the worst prof ever! So rude and condescending he acts like he know everything when he makes a mistake in EVERY class. Midterms cover 10 chapters and he literally tests you on 5 of the hardest written questions ever.  Notes are complete GARBAGE just like his teaching skills. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE TRUST ME!!!!

AVOID! One of the absolute worst instructors I've ever had. He did not teach anything  everything I learned in this course was from my TA or the textbook. He is rude, patronizing, and constantly makes errors in lectures that students had to correct. His lectures had no schedule and jumped all over the textbook. He introduced new material on exams.

It was his first time teaching the course. He's a great presenter - animated & passionate about chemistry. He related the material to the real world. However, his exams were typically not representative of what he had covered in class, and frankly beyond the scope of an introductory chemistry course.

This man ruined my day three times a week.  He is rude, arrogant, and worst of all, he isn't good at teaching.  His lectures are pointless and unrelated to exams.  The textbook taught me everything I know.  So, unless you want to read the whole textbook cover to cover, I would suggest not taking a class with him.

350 characters is not enough to explain how awful this man was, 1 is too high a grade. I read these comments before enrolling and thought I could get by. I was wrong. This man was horrible, he's aggressive, condescending & not helpful in the least. I learned more from 1 online assignment than I did in 3 weeks of lectures. AVOID AT ALL COST!

You know something is wrong when the class average is below 50%. We had two midterms, both of them had 4 questions each. He told us to study a bunch of material, but we weren't tested on most of them.
I hope that I'm not the only one who's always confused in lectures and has failed both midterms...  (this says it all)

passionate about chemistry. probably a great scientist. not a teacher. asks our chem foundations class philosophical questions on exams when we're learning how to name compounds? doesn't give questions related to the text. I got 7 questions wrong on lon capa, & read full text, and haven't passed an exam! lectures entertaining  but a waste of time.

I love the way he lectures, and I feel that I've learned a lot from him but his midterms really come from left field. He knows a ton about what he teaches about, and clearly is passionate but I don't think that he knows how to explain the concepts to people who have never taken chemistry before.

Decides to put material that wasn't taught in the lectures on both midterms. Not a GPA booster, jumps around the textbook a lot. Seems to know the material but doesn't know how to teach it to a class. Averages on tests are below 50%. Homework questions are not explained in class beforehand.

Absolutely brutal going to his class. Extremely unorganized. Never goes to class prepared (besides for syllabus day) and so, lectures are all over the place. Often times, students have to correct him. There is really no use attending his classes. Homework assignments do not reflect exam questions. Failing this class atm.

CHEM110/111: pre-recorded online lectures were much longer than they needed to be. ended up learning mostly on my own. Lab manuals were extremely confusing and even contradictory at times. Had 4 hours to finish the lab, and most of it was just spend trying to figure out instructions, calculating standard deviation, or listening to her stories.

Girl is wack, like literally. Online course material was pretty breezy if you keep up with the weekly assignments and recordings. but my god when it came to labs she was all over the place and so were students. She relatively changed the lab procedure in the process of doing the lab which resulted in redoing the lab and start from scratch.

A lot of material to cover, especially for someone coming from 0 chemistry background. Although there was a lot of weekly assignments (Achieve), just putting in a couple hours and doing them really helped understand the material, especially since you can hand them in late at low consequence.

Prof was very accessible outside of lecture, would rec.
Chem 111 had a ton of material to cover, but prof was super accessible outside of class, and her tests were not as hard as people pretend.

The professor made simple concepts extremely complicated, the exam was a disaster!!!  She provided a problem with 20 questions below, if you can not get the answer the first, YOU CAN NOT do any less of them! Avoid if possible!

So much homework is assigned every week and she never finishes her slides. She rushed through the last week of material and now finals are coming up and she hasn't taught everything. Also, she is constantly talking about her personal life in class.

Dr. Goyan bent over backwards for us to succeed in the spring and every effort was appreciated, by most. The students who complained during her lectures regarding marking were those who did not pay attention to the course content. Dr. Goyan kept me engaged throughout the entire lecture period and answered any and all questions in depth.

She is nice, enthusiastic. Due to Covid, the class, tutorial isn't mandatory so A LOT homework to do in LonCapa and Achieve, before & after lab. I don't watch her video cause reading textbook and doing quiz on it is enough. The lab is pretty heavy but TA is helpful. Midterm is easy, average is 80. Final is more difficult and heavier. Both are MC.

For my class she was alright. Very accommodating and her exams weren't too hefty, but the Canvas page didn't have a discussion section so if you had an issue you could only really email her and not contact other students.

She's a total sweetheart meaning that she has the patience of a saint. Personality aside, she's a prof who will completely understand your position as a student and where your difficulties lies. She's willing to help even when she's really busy, and never loses her cool around you.

Seems like a nice lady. I REALLY wish she would actually do examples in class of certain calculations instead of already having them pre-made on the slides. Also, it would be nice if she could invest in a laser pointer instead of pointing at her lecture notes 50 feet above her with her fingers (really hard to follow along).
Lee was an amazing prof, although her lectures became boring her teaching style is great. she knows how to get information across and assignments are fair.

Had a three year break from my most recent year of Chemistry (grade 11), Lee was able to do a great job of getting me back up to speed! Can be a bit sarcastic if you don't already have a bit of an idea of what is going on, but is very kind and happy to help you out!! Lectures are great, but lots of blank slides for inclass examples!! So don't skip!

Always take notes on the in-class problems because they don't appear on the online slides, and the midterms are fairly rushed so make sure you're prepared to solve equations quickly. Other than that the labs aren't too difficult and the concepts in class are clear. The Lon Capa assignments are a good indicator of what questions are on the tests.

She reads off her slides most of the time and doesn't quite explain things her own way. What she teaches is whatever is in the text. Sometimes she uses similar examples from the text as well, which isn't very helpful when they are easy examples. She tends to put harder examples in her exams, so watch out. Must attend lectures to complete notes tho.

BEST CHEMISTRY TEACHER EVER. Midterms and exams were super easy (but you actually have to study)! Lee Hanlan is super organized and explains concepts in lecture very clearly. As long as you attend lecture and put in some work you should get a decent grade! She does get a little sarcastic when you ask her "stupid" questions though.

I found her to be crystal clear with her lectures. I suggest reading the textbook before exams for more understanding but its not necessary, neither is attending tutorials. Exams were straightforward and covered what we learned in class; not hard at all if you studied! ended up with an A after 3 after of not doing chemistry.
Cares about students.  Awesome person.  Awesome teacher.  I wish she'd take over D'Auria's courses.
not interested, not interesting. knows her stuff well but more enthusiasm would be appreciated.
No Comments
Very clear notes on powerpoint, fair exams, shy but friendly and willing to help! I take a class that he's teaching again.
take this course with the lab...it's worth 20%...which made me an A in this course
He sucks at teaching.  His accent is too strong. oh well, at least his exam was easy..
No Comments

Not good. Don't be fooled by her appearing "helpful". Doesn't ask what u thought about exams (full of mistakes), but she wouldn't know b/c she wasn't there. Final exam way too hard. Full of things we didn't learn. Doesn't guide u by giving homework. Control freak re: cell phones/tablets. Doesn't allow them even tho students use them to take notes.

She has a heart of gold, and I could tell she takes her job seriously. She goes over time a lot and is always concerned whether her students are paying attention (will call you out if you are texting) so that was extremely irritating. She also is not very clear with certain concepts.  But overall she's average.

She's just average. Doesn't reply to many emails and kind of just passes you on to TAs for everything, even though she is a teaching prof and not a research prof. Way too many questions on the Midterm for the time given. I think when a prof sees that 98% of the class didn't finish on time, this should indicate something is wrong.
Incredibly enthusiastic. This Professor epitomizes a passion for teaching. She genuinely cares about her students, and their ability to learnt he material.
BEST Professor!!! Enthusiastic and extremely helpful.

Love her classes! She's enthusiastic and knows what she's talking about, and answers questions concisely and accurately. Her marking is fair, on the easy side. As long as you pay attention in class, which isn't hard, you'll get a good grade.
Shows enthusiasm. Makes things fun.
Passionate about subject. Makes things fun.
He was a very good professor. I learned not only chemistry but even some very basic but I never figured out math skills from this class.

He provides a simplistic explanation to chemistry and is very easy to follow. He gives a lot of practice problems, and is ready to answer questions. Overall, such an approachable person and super helpful. I recommend him if you have not taken chemistry 12 as his lectures are easy to follow, and tests fair.

Great professor, easy to understand, and very funny as well. The only downside is there are a lot of homework, and this is chemistry so homework sometime are not easy. As long as you seek helps, pay attention during lecture and do your homework. You will turn out just fine. After all, chemistry is a hard subject so do your homeworks.

James is a funny guy. Cares for his student and really wants you to do well. Available for questions after class/zoom. Don't have to get a textbook as his notes are crystal clear. Lab sessions with him are hilarious - you gotta love the "clean up" song. Only top 5 quizzes counted. Tutorials mandatory, lecture notes will not be posted online.

James was by far my favorite prof! He genuinely wants everyone to do well and his lectures were a blast. He does plenty of practice problems that are super relevant! Study his notes and do your LON-CAPA and you'll do fine! Note: He does weekly quizzes.
